info.title: Lovdata API
info.description:
# Introduction

## General info

Lovdata provides two free datasets with laws and central regulations respectively, no user or authentication required. These are directly available here:

- Laws: [https://api.lovdata.no/v1/publicData/get/gjeldende-lover.tar.bz2](https://api.lovdata.no/v1/publicData/get/gjeldende-lover.tar.bz2)
- Central regulations: [https://api.lovdata.no/v1/publicData/get/gjeldende-sentrale-forskrifter.tar.bz2](https://api.lovdata.no/v1/publicData/get/gjeldende-sentrale-forskrifter.tar.bz2)
- Further free datasets are available under [https://api.lovdata.no/swagger#/Public%20data](https://api.lovdata.no/swagger#/Public%20data)

The Lovdata API provides a set of URLs and arguments which gives access to document content, document metadata and other functions.

Some of the endpoints require an API account provided by Lovdata. The main exceptions are the Public data endpoints.

This API is extended on a regular basis through the addition of new methods and additional fields in the returned data. Changes that might break backwards compatibility should only be introduced in new versions of the API with different URLs.

## Document identifiers

Throughout much of this document you will encounter the terms `refID` and `dokID`. These are based on the
concepts defined in FRBR (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_Requirements_for_Bibliographic_Records):

* `refID`: FRBR "work"
* `dokID`: FRBR "expression"

Multiple documents can have the same `refID`. For the Penal Code, all these documents have the `refID` `lov/2005-05-20-28` :

* Originally promulgated statute in Lovtidend
* Consolicated act
* English version of the act
* Revoked act, when a new Penal Code is introduced some time in the future

Each of these has a unique `dokID`:

* Promulgated in Lovtidend: `LTI/lov/2005-05-20-28`
* Consolidated act: `NL/lov/2005-05-20-28`
* English version: `NLE/lov/2005-05-20-28`
* Revoked act (does not yet exist): `NLO/lov/2005-05-20-28`

# Authentication

Authentication is done with either Basic Auth or HTTP header X-API-Key. One of these must be sent with each individual request to the various functions specified below.

Authentication is done against a user in Lovdata's user base who must have the role ʻapi`.

## X-API-Key

This is a string that is set on the user in Lovdata's user database. The use is quite simple:

Set HTTP header as follows:

`X-API-Key: <key>`

For example:

`X-API-Key: abcd1234abcd1234`

## Basic Auth

Standard Basic Auth HTTP header with username and password of a single user in Lovdata's user database.

## Check authentication and user info

### Request

Perform a GET request to the endpoint `/v1/userinfo`.

### Response

A successful response will include the following data:

```
{
"userID": 9999,
"login": "user@domain",
"companyID": 999
}
```

A `401 Unauthorized` error indicates that the credentials are not accepted.

# Limitation on frequent calls

All calls have certain restrictions on the number of calls per. minute. The HTTP headers starting with `X-RateLimit-` describe the current rules for authenticated user.

Example:

```
X-RateLimit-Limit: 200
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 199
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1602240594 
```

This means that the limit is 200 calls, there are 199 left, and the limit is set to 200 again at the specified timestamp.

If the limit is reached, the service will answer `429 Too Many Requests`, and `X-RateLimit-Remaining: 0`. When the specified timestamp is reached, the number of available calls will be reset to the maximum value as usual.

tags.name: Public data
tags.description: Public data released under the NLOD 2.0 license. No account or authentication required.

tags.name: Structured rules
tags.description: Retrieve complete documents in structured HTML5/XML format

externalDocs.description: Documentation for the content of the XML/HTML-format (norwegian)

tags.name: Content services
tags.description: Document lists, metadata and rendering in different formats

tags.name: Document upload
tags.description: Methods for transmitting documents to Lovdata

get.summary: Get the index for a specific document
get.description:
Function for retrieving table of contents as a JSON structure.
	
The returned data model is a tree structure with the following data fields:
	
`refID`: For document parts where ID can be interpreted and used by a human to identify the part, this will contain this" semantic ID ". An approximate science, but for many cases very useful.
	
`url`: Same content as ID per. now, may change to full URL in near future.
	
`title`: Title of the document section where applicable. Many old laws do not have a paragraph title, then "title" will typically be the first paragraph etc.
	
`id`: Unique non-semantic structural ID that points to the document part. Here, "mismatch" between refID and ID will often be experienced, e.g. in the example above, but it is "by design".
	
`level`: Level from the top (root level is 0)
	
`children`: List of several nodes that have the current node as parent. Same data model.
	
Example:
`https://api.lovdata.no/documentIndex?refID=NL/lov/1997-02-28-19`

parameters.name: refID
parameters.description: Reference to a document, either unique document ID specified with legal source or if the legal source is missing, the function tries to interpret this into the most probable document.

200.description: Document index tree with titles and child parts

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.description:
Retrieves list of past and future versions of given document.

### Example request

Request: 

`/documentHistory?refID=lov/2005-05-20-28`

parameters.name: refID
parameters.description: `refID`: Either unique document ID specified with legal source. If the legal source is missing, the function tries to interpret this into the most probable document.

200.description: List of documents that are historic versions of the given refID

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.description:
Retrieves list of changed documents in a period of time.
							
### Example request

Request: `/baseHistory?base=NL&limit=20`
```

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Legal source: NL, SF, LF, DEL, INS, STV

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Date in ISO 8601-format (yyyy-mm-dd)

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Date in ISO 8601-format (yyyy-mm-dd)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of documents per page, default 100

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination: Show document from this number, default 0

200.description: List of documents changed in the given time period

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: List all documents in a legal source
get.description: Given a legal source, list the `dokID`s of every document contained in the source.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Short form of legal source, for example base: `NL`, `SF`, `LF`, `DEL`, `INS`, `STV`

200.description: List of documents belonging to the given legal source

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Get metadata for a single document

parameters.name: dokID
parameters.description: Unique document ID, for example NL/lov/2005-05-20-28

200.description: Metadata for the given document

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Check the existence of a document or reference
get.description: Checks if the given `refID` or `dokID` exists and returns a boolean.

parameters.name: refID
parameters.description: Reference to a document, either unique document ID specified with legal source or if the legal source is missing, the function tries to interpret this into the most probable document.

parameters.name: dokID
parameters.description: Unique document ID, for example NL/lov/2005-05-20-28

200.description: Boolean indicating whether the reference/document exists or not

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Simple method to render documents or parts as HTML
get.description:
Call to draw content as HTML.

Example: `https://api.lovdata.no/renderRefID?refID=lov/2005-05-20-28/§4`

parameters.name: refID
parameters.description: Either the semantic ID `lov/2005-05-20-28` (where the function guesses what you are looking for), or legal source-specific `NL/lov/2005-05-20-28` (these represent basic Work and Expression from FRBR).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: `html` or `json`, which is HTML wrapped as a JSON object. Default `html`.

200.description: Returns HTML for specified document part. If the document part is not specified, meta information ("header") for the document is returned.

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Locate references in the given input text
get.description: References are returned both applied to the original text as anchors, and as a model detailing the found references and their locations in the input text. Using the POST endpoint ensures that no content will be logged or saved on our servers.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to be analyzed

parameters.name: dokID
parameters.description: Unique document ID, for example NL/lov/2005-05-20-28

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date in ISO 8601-format (yyyy-mm-dd)

200.description: Genref operation was successful

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

post.summary: Locate references in the given input text
post.description: References are returned both applied to the original text as anchors, and as a model detailing the found references and their locations in the input text. Using the POST endpoint ensures that no content will be logged or saved on our servers.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to be analyzed

parameters.name: dokID
parameters.description: Unique document ID, for example NL/lov/2005-05-20-28

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date in ISO 8601-format (yyyy-mm-dd)

200.description: Genref operation was successful

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

200.description: Responds with "pong" to indicate service up and running
Current userID, login and companyID

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: List legal sources containing available documents

200.description: List of legal sources with available documents

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: List available documents in a given legal source

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Legal source

200.description: List of available documents in the given legal source

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Get a single document in structured format

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Legal source

parameters.name: ruleFile
parameters.description: File name

200.description: File content in the requested format

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Get the version of the document in force at the given date

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Legal source

parameters.name: ruleFile
parameters.description: The document to return the version for at the given date

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date in ISO 8601-format (yyyy-mm-dd)

200.description: File content in the requested format

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: List the available versions of the given document

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Legal source

parameters.name: ruleFile
parameters.description: The document to show history for

200.description: List of documents consisting of a timeline for the given document

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

parameters.name: baseName
parameters.description: Legal source to upload the file to

requestBody.description: baseName: Short form of legal source, for example base: `NL`, `SF`, `LF`, `DEL`, `INS`, `STV`, filer sendes som multipart/form

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

200.description: Lists available packages

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: File to download

200.description: Binary data with the contents of the specified file

get.summary: Full-text search across all legal sources

parameters.name: emne1
parameters.description: Søketerm

parameters.name: emne2
parameters.description: Søketerm

parameters.name: emne3
parameters.description: Søketerm

parameters.name: teksthenvisning
parameters.description: Referanser innholder

parameters.name: rows
parameters.description: Max rows to return (used for pagination)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip the first n rows of the result (used for pagination)

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Short form of legal source, for example base: `NL`, `SF`, `LF`, `DEL`, `INS`, `STV`

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Sort by the given field

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort direction, either DESC eller ASC

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Show results from the given ISO8601 date (inclusive)

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Show results to the given ISO8601 date (exclusive)

200.description: Search operation was successful

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Download documents or parts of documents in a variety of formats

parameters.name: dokID
parameters.description: Unique document ID, for example NL/lov/2005-05-20-28

parameters.name: refID
parameters.description: Reference to a document, either unique document ID specified with legal source or if the legal source is missing, the function tries to interpret this into the most probable document.

parameters.name: partID
parameters.description: Document part ID

parameters.name: partType
parameters.description: Document part type

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: File type, one of docx, pdf, html, epub, txt

200.description: Binary data with the document content in the requested format

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Detailed information about promulgated changes to parts of regulation

parameters.name: dokID
parameters.description: Unique document ID, for example NL/lov/2005-05-20-28

parameters.name: partID
parameters.description: ID of a part of a document. Supports several types of IDs: Section IDs (`§12-2`), Chapter IDs (`kap12-1`, `KAPITTEL_12-1`).

200.description: Structured representation of the change history for the given regulation

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: List all legal sources with descriptions
get.description: List all legal sources in Lovdatas databases. Note that content from several sources are unavailabe through this API.

200.description: List legal sources successful

401.description: Authentication needed for this request. See description in the Authentication section of the General info.

get.summary: Search using a specified strategy, given either a text query
get.description: Using the POST endpoint ensures that no content will be logged or saved on our servers.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: User query

parameters.name: strategy
parameters.description: The name of the class implementing a search strategy. One of 'LovSourcedReferenceGraphStrategy'

parameters.name: legalAreas
parameters.description: Comma separated list of legal area codes to limit the search to

200.description: Search completed successfully

value.title: Too many requests

post.summary: Search using a specified strategy, given either a text query or vector input
post.description: Using the POST endpoint ensures that no content will be logged or saved on our servers.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: User query

parameters.name: vector
parameters.description: Embedding vector of type text-embedding-3-large, comma separated list of 3072 floats. Either this or text must be specified.

parameters.name: strategy
parameters.description: The name of the class implementing a search strategy. One of 'LovSourcedReferenceGraphStrategy'

parameters.name: legalAreas
parameters.description: Comma separated list of legal area codes to limit the search to

200.description: Search completed successfully
